description.narrative: Community and smallholder forestry has the potential to bring economic security to many rural communities in Solomon Islands. But there are an estimated 8-10 thousand ha of existing smallholder plantations that need thinning to the final stocking rate in order to produce high value timber, and often there is inadequate infrastructure available to get the timber to market. This project seeks to further develop economic opportunities through more widespread application of high-value agroforestry and improved management of secondary forests. Its specific objectives are: to improve the quality and availability of germplasm resources for community forestry programs; to enhance information resources to facilitate development of marketing and processing systems for smallholder timber resources; to increase landowner and community understanding and adoption of agroforestry systems.
